Understate: The claim may understate the impact of Obamacare by suggesting that 30 million people will still be without health insurance, without acknowledging that the law would actually reduce the number of uninsured individuals by 25 million.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that 30 million people will still be without health insurance.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that the number of uninsured individuals would be much higher without the implementation of Obamacare.
